slides.title: The Power of Charity
slides.introductionText: In this lesson, we will explore the deep meaning of charity, the pure love of Christ, and how it transforms our lives.

slides.title: The Good Samaritan
slides.description: A man was traveling and was attacked by robbers. Religious leaders passed him by, but a Samaritan showed compassion and cared for him.
slides.historicalContext: Jews and Samaritans traditionally had great enmity; this story taught Christlike compassion that transcends social barriers.

scriptures.verse: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassion on him.

quotes.text: True charity is love in action.
quotes.author: President Thomas S. Monson

thoughtProvokingQuestions: When have you been the recipient of unexpected compassion?
How can we overcome biases that prevent us from showing love to others?

artwork.title: The Good Samaritan by Walter Rane

mediaPresentation.overlayQuote: By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.

slides.title: Summary
slides.summary: Charity is the essence of discipleship. As we serve others, we draw closer to Christ.
mainPoints: We are commanded to love one another

slides.title: Preparation Notes
preparationAdvice: Study Luke 10 and related conference talks.
Pray for inspiration for class discussions.
engagementTips: Invite members to share personal experiences of charity.
Use role-play to discuss modern-day Good Samaritan examples.
